citeinfo.origin: Japan Agency for Marine-Earth Science and Technology (JAMSTEC)
citeinfo.title: JAMSTEC Ocean General Circulation Model for the Earth Simulator (OFES)

abstract.p: Ocean model for the Earth Simulator (OFES) is a global 0.1x0.1 degree model forced by NCEP winds. OFES was run for 50 years to provide various outputs including climatology and hindcast model outputs at 0.1 and 0.5 degree grid.

Note: In the ocean, typical size of eddies is horizontal 100 km order, which plays significant role on momentum and heat transportation. In order to reproduce eddies, the horizontal resolution of OFES is as small as 10 km. Meanwhile, in order to simulate the entire ocean, the whole globe except the two poles was set to be the calculation area. In the ocean simulation by OFES, various currents such as the Kuroshio south of Japan as well as fairly small eddies of 100 km order are all well reproduced.

descript.purpose: To study ocean currents and eddies as well as ocean circulation at global scale. To make contribution in the study of the ocean general circulation, and further for studies on climate change including global warming, affected by the variation in the ocean general circulation.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
